name: Flak
descriptions: Flak is a former slaver from Paradise Falls, who chose to start a new life in Rivet City. He runs the Flak 'N Shrapnel's weapons store in the marketplace together with his partner, Shrapnel, and appears in Fallout 3.
His non-stereotypical portrayal is a major part of the game's LGBT representation.

Born around 2227, Flak was a slaver in his younger years, running with the Paradise Falls slavers. After years and years of trading in human lives, Flak chose to make a clean break and begin a new life at Rivet City.
He has been able to live in the City for years in peace,

He's been living at Rivet City and running guns for years, developing a rapport with its citizens and security force. He approaches marketing by encouraging potential customers to visit his shop and upgrade
Flak is a fan of mirelurk cakes, and typically orders two when dining at Gary's Galley.

Shrapnel is the closest relationship Flak has, with the two maintaining professional appearances while at work. Flak has a tendency to worry overly much in Shrapnel's opinion, especially when it comes to stock such as ammunition: What Shrapnel considers fine, Flak thinks low.
However, everyone outside Shrapnel is kept at arms' length. Flak will engage in small talk and politely thank for advice - especially if it's about bad food items at the galley
He does have a soft spot for Trinnie, however, buying her drinks when she asks, pretending it's "just this once".
Flak has two major conditions affecting his schedule: Whether Shrapnel is alive and whether Flack is enslaved. By default:
If Shrapnel dies (not possible in normal gameplay, as he's marked as essential), his schedule is altered:
If enslaved, Flak's packages are disabled and he's moved to the slave house at Paradise Falls, with a single sandbox package.
Flak is named after the English term for anti-aircraft fire, coined during World War II from the German abbreviation for anti-aircraft gun (FlaK, from Flugabwehrkanone).

topics.response_text: It's almost closing time. I'd get out of here if I was you.

topics.topic: MS03RCHistory1Could I ask you about Rivet City's history?
topics.topic_text: Know anything about the history of Rivet City?
topics.response_text: 'Fraid I can't help you, pal. Been here for years, but all I know about the history is that it's a safe place to settle down.

topics.topic: MS08TopicPinkertonIs there anyone on this ship named Pinkerton?
topics.topic_text: You ever hear of a guy named Pinkerton?
Aren't you afraid someone will use your own guns to rob you?
Do you have the big stuff? Flamers, Missile Launchers, stuff like that?
topics.response_text: We usually have a few. I'd have to check the inventory.

topics.topic_text: This is quite a selection, but they're all in lousy condition.
topics.response_text: I don't put the good stuff out on the table. If you're interested, I can show you the stuff in the locker.

topics.topic_text: Cute names. Did you make them up, or are you just trying to look tough?
topics.response_text: Like that's your real name?{sarcasm, emphasis "your"}

topics.topic_text: This peashooter has saved my ass more than once.
topics.response_text: I'm sure that was just luck. You should upgrade. Check out our shop in the market.

topics.topic: RCTopicGetDrinksWhere can I get a stiff drink?
topics.topic_text: Is there anywhere I can get a drink on this tub?
topics.response_text: Try the Muddy Rudder. They don't ask too many questions down on the lower deck.

topics.topic_text: Did you know that Paulie Cantelli is an addict?
topics.response_text: He's totally strung out. It's going to kill him one of these days.

topics.topic: RivetCityBarterI'm here to do business with you.
topics.topic_text: Can I see what kinds of guns you have for sale?
topics.response_text: Need to do some killin' eh?

topics.topic_text: I need you to repair my stuff.

conversation.response_text: If you need more ammo, this is where to get it.
How's our ammo inventory? It was getting low yesterday.
Can't complain. I've got some new stuff in. You should come by and take a look.
I've heard enough for tonight.{slightly slurred, he's had too much to drink.}
